thread.title: Palmetto Sunrise: Who will heal the rift in the GOP?
thread.title_full: Palmetto Sunrise: Who will heal the rift in the GOP? - Post and Courier

author: David MacDougall
title: Palmetto Sunrise: Who will heal the rift in the GOP?
text:
U.S. Rep. Mick Mulvaney, R-South Carolina, was on CBC-TV’s “Face the Nation” Sunday representing the Freedom Caucus, a group of conservative Republican lawmakers. CBS News/Provided × As Republican presidential hopefuls continue to grouse at one another, a new sideshow in the GOP is taking the spotlight off the primary race.
House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy, R-California, who seemed to be the heir apparent to outgoing House Speaker John Boehner, on Thursday withdrew from consideration , sending House leadership into a tizzy.
Boehner, who on Sept. 25 announced he would resign from Congress, vowed to stay on until a successor is found. Conservative Republican lawmakers, who had expressed delight in Boehner’s relinquishment of power, seem to be unable to settle on who should take the helm.
By Friday, Rep. Paul Ryan of Wisconsin had emerged as the person with the most buzz, but Ryan was saying he did not want the job.
Rep. Mick Mulvaney, R-South Carolina, was on CBS’s “Face the Nation” Sunday saying that the Freedom Caucus, a group of conservative representatives, was still backing Florida Rep. Daniel Webster for the post, but much of the discussion between Mulvaney and “Face the Nation” host John Dickerson was about Ryan and whether he would be acceptable to conservatives.
To read more:
House Republicans ask: Can anyone lead us? ( The Associated Press )
Hometown lets Paul Ryan ponder speaker job on own terms ( New York Times )
Meanwhile, the presidential race continues. And of course, the topic of who should serve as Speaker of the House seems to come up whenever one of the would-be presidents is talking with reporters.
Chris Christie says Americans don’t care who’s House Speaker ( Bloomberg )
Carson: ‘I like Paul Ryan’ ( The Hill )
Donald Trump: I’d “be okay” with Paul Ryan as House Speaker ( CBS News )
Lindsey Graham backs Paul Ryan for the Speaker’s job ( Boston Herald )

Columbus Day is not a state holiday but it is a federal one. There will be no mail delivered and many banks as well as federal offices are closed today.
Expect this holiday to continue to undergo rethinking in the years ahead.
More cities celebrating ‘Indigenous Peoples Day’ as effort to abolish Columbus Day grows ( Washington Post )
